results.title: U.S. Law Enforcement Failed to See the Threat of White Nationalism. Now They Don’t Know How to Stop It.
results.abstract: For two decades, domestic counterterrorism strategy has ignored the rising danger of far-right extremism. In the atmosphere of willful indifference, a virulent movement has grown and metastasized.

results.title: Anguished by ‘Spiral of Hate,’ Charleston Pastor and Pittsburgh Rabbi Grieve as One

results.title: A Nation in Turmoil Prepares to Deliver a Verdict on Trump
results.abstract: Republicans have grown increasingly pessimistic about holding the House, as polls show a number of incumbents lagging well below 50 percent. G.O.P. leaders are more hopeful about the Senate.
results.byline: By ALEXANDER BURNS and JONATHAN MARTIN

results.title: At Trump Rallies, Women See a Hero Protecting a Way of Life
results.abstract: While female voters may be President Trump’s greatest electoral weakness, his fear-based appeals on immigration and other issues seemed to resonate with women at his campaign events.

results.title: Rural America’s Own Private Flint: Polluted Water Too Dangerous to Drink
results.abstract: The lack of clean water is tied to industrial farms and slack regulations tainting wells across the Midwest and beyond.

multimedia.caption: A ditch along land owned by the Wysocki Produce Farm in Armenia Township, Wis. Manure-tainted runoff can contaminate private wells, which are regulated by few water-quality rules.
multimedia.copyright: Lauren Justice for The New York Times

results.title: An Operatic Love Story Starts Off on a Sour Note
